skill.name: hft-quant-expert
skill.description: Quantitative trading expertise for DeFi and crypto derivatives. Use when building trading strategies, signals, risk management. Triggers on signal, backtest, alpha, sharpe, volatility, correlation, position size, risk.
skill.summary: Quantitative trading expertise for DeFi and crypto derivatives. Use when building trading strategies...
skill.author: BarisSozen

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. Contains only instructional content about quantitative trading formulas and best practices. No network calls, filesystem access, or external commands detected.

content.value_statement: Developing profitable DeFi and crypto trading strategies requires specialized knowledge of risk management and backtesting. This skill provides expert formulas and workflows for z-score signals, Kelly Criterion position sizing, and avoiding common pitfalls like lookahead bias.
actual_capabilities: Calculate z-score entry signals for trading strategies
Apply Kelly Criterion for position sizing with 0.25x multiplier
Compute annualized Sharpe ratio for performance evaluation
Identify and avoid backtesting pitfalls like lookahead bias
Estimate mean reversion half-life for timing strategies
Account for gas and slippage costs in profit calculations
limitations: Does not execute live trades or connect to exchanges
Does not provide real-time market data or price feeds
Does not guarantee profitable trading outcomes
Requires user to verify formulas and implement in their own code

use_cases.title: Develop systematic strategies
use_cases.description: Build and backtest quantitative trading strategies for DeFi and crypto markets using proven mathematical frameworks.

use_cases.title: Calculate risk metrics
use_cases.description: Compute key metrics like Sharpe ratio, z-scores, and position sizes for portfolio optimization and risk management.

use_cases.title: Avoid backtesting errors
use_cases.description: Learn to identify and prevent common pitfalls like lookahead bias, survivorship bias, and overfitting.

prompt_templates.title: Basic signal calculation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I calculate a z-score signal for a crypto trading strategy? Show me the formula and how to implement it.

prompt_templates.title: Position sizing
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me calculate the Kelly Criterion fraction for a trading strategy with 60% win rate and 1.5 win/loss ratio.

prompt_templates.title: Performance metrics
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the formula for annualized Sharpe ratio? I have daily returns and want to assess my strategy performance.

prompt_templates.title: Backtesting validation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I check if my backtest has lookahead bias or overfitting? What validation techniques should I use?

output_examples.input: Help me calculate position size using Kelly Criterion for a strategy with 55% win rate and 2.0 win/loss ratio.
output: Key tips: Full Kelly is volatile, consider fractional Kelly for stability

best_practices: Always use fractional Kelly (0.25x) to reduce volatility and drawdown risk
Include gas costs and slippage in all profit calculations before trading
Validate backtests for lookahead bias using out-of-sample testing
Annualize Sharpe correctly: 252 for daily data, 365*24 for hourly data
anti_patterns: Using full Kelly without considering the extreme volatility and drawdowns
Ignoring transaction costs like gas and slippage in backtests
Overfitting strategies by optimizing on too many parameters
Using future data in backtests (lookahead bias) that would not be available live

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides trading expertise through conversational prompts.

faq.question: What are the position sizing limits?
faq.answer: The skill recommends using 0.25x Kelly Criterion as a conservative approach to position sizing.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my trading system?
faq.answer: Use the provided formulas to implement in your own code. The skill provides mathematical frameworks only.

faq.question: Is my trading data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. No data is stored or transmitted. Your trading data stays on your system.

faq.question: Why is my backtest failing in live trading?
faq.answer: Common causes include lookahead bias, overfitting, and ignoring transaction costs. Review the pitfalls section.

faq.question: How does this compare to other trading tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides mathematical frameworks rather than executing trades. Use exchange APIs for live trading.
